description: "Blossoms Shanghai" is A 30-part TV series directed by acclaimed Hong Kong filmmaker Wong Kar-wai, set in the 1990's that has become a huge hit in China. Our China correspondent tells us the nostalgia unleashed by the show tells us a lot about how people in China are feeling these days.
title: What a Hit Chinese TV Show Tells Us About China Today

description: Federal money and resources are flowing to Maryland as authorities scramble to remove the wreckage of the Francis Scott Key Bridge. But they acknowledge the effort will not be easy, cheap or quick.
title: A giant crane arrives in Baltimore, but leaders see a 'daunting' cleanup job ahead

description: The likely first step will likely be securing the massive container ship that brought the bridge down on Tuesday. Then, clearing debris from the shipping channel.
title: Clearing Baltimore's shipping channel won't be easy, will take at least weeks

description: Anthropocene refers to the age of humans — the things we've done to Earth. Geologists just rejected a proposal to declare an official "Anthropocene epoch." But everyone agrees: Damage has been done.
title: Mercy me: Photos show what humans have done to the planet in the Anthropocene age

description: The court said the state did not have enough evidence to prove that Mason knew she was ineligible to vote when she cast a ballot in the 2016 election. She was facing a five-year prison sentence.
title: Texas appeals court acquits Crystal Mason's illegal voting conviction

description: Gossett won the award for An Officer And A Gentleman, and also got an Emmy for Roots. More recent prominent roles for the Broadway star and civil rights activist were in The Color Purple and Watchmen.
title: Louis Gossett Jr., the 1st Black man to win a supporting actor Oscar, dies at 87

description: Maynor Suazo Sandoval left Honduras when he was 20 and built a new life in the U.S. He is one of the missing workers from the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge.
title: 'A generous man': Baltimore bridge worker helped family, community in Honduras

description: A new report by Children and Screens rounds up the changes spurred by the United Kingdom's Age Appropriate Design Code, which went into effect in 2020.
title: Social media companies made changes to comply with U.K. rules to safeguard kids

description: The EPA has finalized the strictest-ever limits on greenhouse gas emissions from heavy-duty trucks, a category that includes everything from buses to garbage trucks.
title: EPA's new rules to clean up heavy trucking met with support and criticism

description: When Yale's marching band wasn't able to make it to March Madness, the Sound of Idaho stepped in — and went viral. A week later, Connecticut's governor proclaimed a "University of Idaho Day."
title: Why the University of Idaho marching band are now heroes in Connecticut

description: Cleaning up the Baltimore bridge collapse won't be quick, easy or inexpensive. Disgraced FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried is sentenced to 24 years for fraud.
title: Baltimore bridge collapse threatens jobs; Sam Bankman-Fried gets 25-year sentence

description: The memo outlines how government agencies can implement artificial intelligence and requires that agencies have a chief AI officer.
title: The White House issued new rules on how government can use AI. Here's what they do

description: It's been a wild historic ride: The price of cocoa topped the all-time record before Valentine's Day and has almost doubled since then, in time for Easter. The culprit is the weather.
title: Bad news, chocolate lovers: Cocoa prices have risen faster than bitcoin

description: Palestinians in Gaza tell NPR they've resorted to boiling weeds in seawater, eating animal feed and grinding date pits. "If the bombs don't kill us, the hunger will," a teenage girl says.
title: Boiling weeds, eating animal feed: People in Gaza stave off hunger any way they can

description: North Carolina State isn't a prototypical Cinderella — they're from a major conference, and they won it all in the 1970s and '80s — but they're the only double-digit seed left. Learn to love them.
title: Looking for Cinderella? Here's the biggest underdog left in March Madness

description: Is Kevin Hart funny? Are pugs cute? Is Donald Trump a good politician? Thankfully, the quiz doesn't need to answer these questions — we'll just stick to the facts, thanks.
title: A comedian, a pug and a politician walk into the quiz. Do you know the punchline?

description: Scientists think the timing of exercise might matter for performance — and for your overall health. Here's what to know about their latest findings.
title: Your muscles keep time too. How circadian rhythms affect your workout and your health

description: It's been a year since Russia detained Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich on spying allegations.
title: U.S. reporter Evan Gershkovich has now spent a whole year jailed in Russia

description: The film's release in Japan, more than eight months after it opened in the U.S., had been watched with trepidation because of the sensitivity of the subject matter.
title: 'Oppenheimer' finally premieres in Japan to mixed reactions and high emotions

description: Republicans in Georgia have repeatedly floated election changes in the wake of false claims by former President Donald Trump and other Republicans that he lost Georgia in 2020 because of fraud.
title: Georgia lawmakers pass new election rules that could impact 2024 presidential contest

description: In January, a door plug flew off a Boeing 737 Max 9 plane during a flight, leaving a hole in the fuselage, some of which are produced by Spirit AeroSystems Holdings, Inc.
title: The Texas attorney general is investigating a supplier of Boeing 737 parts
